message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String number = "(1234) 567-8910";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(number, "-() ", true);
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String token = st.nextToken();
            if (!token.equals("-") && !token.equals("(") && !token.equals(")") && !token.equals(" ")) {
                System.out.println(token);
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In the provided code, we are creating a StringTokenizer object with the string number and the delimiters "-() ". The third parameter is set to true to return the delimiters as tokens. Then, we are using a while loop to iterate through all the tokens. If the token is not a delimiter, we print it. This way, we can split the string based on multiple delimiters at the same time.
